sandy.parser.Parser

type
class
The Parser factory class creates instances of parser classes. The specific parser can be specified in the create method's second parameter. @author Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou @author Niel Drummond - haXe port @author Russell WEir - haXe port @version 3.1 @date 04.08.2007 @example To parse a 3DS file at runtime: var parser:IParser = Parser.create( "/path/to/my/3dsfile.3ds", Parser.MAX_3DS );

Static Variables

ASE : String

Specifies that the ASE (ASCII Scene Export) parser should be used.

COLLADA : String

Specifies that the COLLADA (COLLAborative Design Activity ) parser should be used.

MAX_3DS : String

Specifies that the 3DS (3D Studio) parser should be used.

MD2 : String

Specifies that the MD2 (Quake II model) parser should be used.

Static Methods

create<ParserClass, URL>(p_sFile : URL, ?p_sParserType : String, ?p_nScale : Float, ?p_sTextureExtension : String) : ParserClass

parameters:
p_sFile Can be either a string pointing to the location of the file or an instance of an embedded file
p_sParserType The parser type string
p_nScale The scale factor
p_sTextureExtension Overrides texture extension.
returns:
The parser to be used
The create method chooses which parser to use. This can be done automatically by looking at the file extension or by passing the parser type String as the second parameter. @example To parse a 3DS file at runtime: var parser:IParser = Parser.create( "/path/to/my/3dsfile.3ds", Parser.3DS );
